alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 8:41PM PDT until May 09 at 11:30AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Okanogan River near Tonasket affecting Okanogan County. .Additional precipitation amounts up to a quarter inch combined with ongoing snow melt will result in increased runoff into the Okanogan River. For the Okanogan River...including Tonasket...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Okanogan River near Tonasket. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, Minor flooding in low lying areas and pasture lands is likely from Omak to Tonasket, especially near Ellisford. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM PDT Friday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached around midday Sunday. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Okanogan River Tonasket 15.0 13.3 Fri 7 pm PDT 14.2 15.3 15.0 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 600 PM PDT.
